oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 48 d
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 48 d. Newspaper clipping: Women To Serve In Elections. News Sentinel. August 18, 1919.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
WOMEN TO SERVE IN ELECTIONS Two are Among Appointments for Constitutional Convention Election OFFICERS CHOSEN For All Except Two Wards and Twenty-Four County Precincts For the first time In Knoxville's history women have been appointed to serve as election officers. They will assist in holding the constitutional convention election Septem- ber 4. Miss Willie Cleage has been appointed a clerk of the election in the second ward and Mrs. J.M. Munlyn has been appointed a registrar in the fifteenth ward. Both these women have taken an active part in the interest of women's participation in the campaign and elections. Several women are serving as registrars, in recognition of the recently conferred privilege of suffrage and its vindication in the courts and the appointment of women among the election officials marks the official entrance of women in municipal politics and government in Knoxville. The appointment of election officialis in all except two wards, the sixth and seventh, was announced this morning by members of the Knox county election commission. The appolntment of the officers in several precincts of the county was also made, but appointments for the coun- ty are far from complete. The officers of the wards in which they have been appointed and those of the coun- ty precincts in which they have been appointed follow: First ward-Officer, H. S. Mabry, Judges, H. H. Schrader, C. M. Johnson, W. M. Maples; Clerks, D. A. Swaggerty, Deaderick Reed; Registrars, J. G. Cannon, Don King. Second Ward-Officer, C. L. La- rew; Judges, B. E. McMillan, John Thornburg, A. P.
